      private static String[] removeArrows​(String[] input)
      O(n), This methods primary purpose is to fix a problem I made because I didn't think this through fully
      Parameters:
      array - of Strings, named input, with arrows
      Returns:
      array of Strings without arrows

    • addArrows

      public static String[] addArrows​(String[] input)
      O(n) efficiency, adds arrows to the string This will be to determine later which elements are mobile and not mobile Should only be called once at the beginning of the JT algorithm
      Parameters:
      array - of Strings, named input
      Returns:
      array of Strings, named input, with arrows

    • hasMobileElements

      public static boolean hasMobileElements​(String[] input)
      O(n), Goes through array and determines if there is a mobile element present in the array, as soon as it finds at least one it returns true
      Parameters:
      array - of Strings, named input
      Returns:
      found mobile element (true), no mobile element found (false)

    • isMobileElement

      public static boolean isMobileElement​(String[] input, int index)
      O(1), Checks mobility of a given element. Element is mobile if the element adjacent to it in the direction of its arrow, has a smaller value than the element. So >2 >1, 2 is mobile. >3 <2 >4 <1, 3 and 4 are mobile
      Parameters:
      array - of Strings, named input
      index - of the element we check for mobility
      Returns:
      true if the element is mobile, false if it is not

    • leftOrRightArrow

      public static String leftOrRightArrow​(String input)
      O(1), looks at first char of the string and checks if it is a left or right arrow
      Parameters:
      String - named input
      Returns:
      "left" or "right"

    • switchArrows

      public static String[] switchArrows​(String[] input, String str)
      O(n), Takes a String and goes through the list and decides if you need to switch the arrow. If in the for loop the element at index is greater than value of @param str, switch the arrow
      Parameters:
      array - of Strings, named input
      String - str
      Returns:
      array of Strings after switching arrows

    • switchArrow

      public static String switchArrow​(String input)
      O(1), if the arrows is right, switch it to left, vice versa
      Parameters:
      String - named input
      Returns:
      String with switched arrow

    • findMaxMobileElement

      public static int findMaxMobileElement​(String[] input)
      O(n), goes through the array of Strings and finds the highest value element and returns the index of the element
      Parameters:
      Array - of Strings input
      Returns:
      index of the highest value mobile element
